original: Majjhima Nikāya 4
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Bhayabheravasutta
analyzed: bhayabheravasutta
translated: Fear and Dread

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.🔽Atha kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme  atha kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park. 🔽Then the brahmin Jānussoṇi went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and said to the Buddha:

original: “yeme, bho gotama, kulaputtā bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ uddissa saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ🔽pabbajitā, bhavaṁ tesaṁ gotamo pubbaṅgamo, bhavaṁ tesaṁ gotamo bahukāro, bhavaṁ tesaṁ gotamo samādapetā;
analyzed: ye ime bho gotama kula puttāḥ bhavantam gotamam uddissa saddhāḥ agārasma anagāriya  pabbajitā bhavam tesam gotamo pubbaṅgamaḥ bhavam tesam gotamo bahu kāraḥ bhavam tesam gotamo samādapetā
translated: “Master Gotama, those gentlemen who have gone forth from the lay life to homelessness under Master Gotama

original: bhoto ca pana gotamassa sā janatā diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjatī”ti.
analyzed: bhoto ca pana gotamassa sā janatā diṭṭha anugatim āpajjati iti
translated: are Master Gotama’s pupils. Master Gotama is their leader, their guide, and their director, and they follow in his footsteps.”

original: “Evametaṁ, brāhmaṇa, evametaṁ, brāhmaṇa.
analyzed: evam eta brāhmaṇa evam eta brāhmaṇa
translated: “Brahmin, it is just so. It is just so.

original: Ye te, brāhmaṇa, kulaputtā mamaṁ uddissa saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā, ahaṁ tesaṁ pubbaṅgamo, ahaṁ tesaṁ bahukāro, ahaṁ tesaṁ samādapetā;
analyzed: ye te brāhmaṇa kula puttāḥ mamam uddissa saddhāḥ agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajitāḥ aham tesam pubbaṅgamaḥ aham tesam bahu kāro aham tesam samādapetā
translated: Those gentlemen who have gone forth from the home life into homelessness out of faith in me, I am their leader, I am their guide, I am their resort, I am their refuge.

original: mama ca pana sā janatā diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjatī”ti.
analyzed: mama ca pana sā janatā diṭṭha anugatim āpajjati iti
translated: And they follow my example.”

original: “Durabhisambhavāni hi kho, bho gotama, araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni, dukkaraṁ pavivekaṁ, durabhiramaṁ ekatte,
analyzed: durabhisambhavāni hi kho bho gotama arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni dukkaram durabhiramam ekatte
translated: “Master Gotama, forest wildernesses and remote abodes are hard to endure, seclusion is hard to practice, and it is hard to enjoy being alone.

original: haranti maññe mano vanāni samādhiṁ alabhamānassa bhikkhuno”ti.
analyzed: haranti maññe manaḥ vanāni samādhim a labhamānassa bhikkhuno ti
translated: They seem to steal away the mind of a monk who has not developed concentration.”

original: “Evametaṁ, brāhmaṇa, evametaṁ, brāhmaṇa.
analyzed: evam eta brāhmaṇa evam eta brāhmaṇa
translated: “So it is, brahmin, so it is!

original: Durabhisambhavāni hi kho, brāhmaṇa, araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni, dukkaraṁ pavivekaṁ, durabhiramaṁ ekatte,
analyzed: durabhisambhavāni hi kho brāhmaṇa arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni dukkaram durabhiramam ekatte
translated: Forest wildernesses and remote abodes are hard to endure, seclusion is hard to practice, and it is hard to enjoy being alone.

original: haranti maññe mano vanāni samādhiṁ alabhamānassa bhikkhuno.
analyzed: haranti maññe manaḥ vanāni samādhim a labhamānassa bhikkhuno
translated: They seem to steal away the mind of a monk who has not developed concentration.

original: Mayhampi kho, brāhmaṇa, pubbeva sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattasseva sato etadahosi:
analyzed: mayham pi kho brāhmaṇa pubbā iva sambodhā an abhisambuddhassa bodhisattassa iva sataḥ etat ahosi
translated: Before my enlightenment, while I was still only an unenlightened Bodhisatta, I too considered thus:

original: ‘durabhisambhavāni hi kho araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni, dukkaraṁ pavivekaṁ, durabhiramaṁ ekatte,
analyzed: durabhisambhavāni hi kho arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni dukkaram durabhiramam ekatte
translated: ‘The wilderness and remote jungle tracts are hard to live in, hard to enjoy, and it’s hard to find pleasure in them.

original: haranti maññe mano vanāni samādhiṁ alabhamānassa bhikkhuno’ti.
analyzed: haranti maññe manaḥ vanāni samādhim a labhamānassa bhikkhuno ti
translated: They steal the mind of a monk who hasn’t developed his mind.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: Then I thought:

original: ‘ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā aparisuddhakāyakammantā araññavanapatthāni pantāni
analyzed: ye kho keci samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā a parisuddha kāya kammantāḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni
translated: ‘There are some contemplatives & brahmans who, though they frequent wilderness & remote jungle tracts,

original: senāsanāni paṭisevanti, aparisuddhakāyakammantasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā
analyzed: senāsanāni paṭisevanti a parisuddha kāya kammanta sandosa hetu have te bhonto samaṇa brāhmaṇā
translated: still have impure bodily, verbal, & mental action. Because of having impure bodily, verbal, & mental action,

original: akusalaṁ bhayabheravaṁ avhāyanti.
analyzed: akusalam bhaya bheravam avhāyanti
translated: they experience mental pain & grief.

original: Na kho panāhaṁ aparisuddhakāyakammanto araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi;
analyzed: na kho pana aham a parisuddha kāya kammantaḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi
translated: But I don’t frequent wilderness & remote jungle tracts with impure bodily, verbal, & mental action.

original: parisuddhakāyakammantohamasmi.
analyzed: parisuddha kāya kammantaḥ ham asmi
translated: I have pure bodily, verbal, & mental action.

original: Ye hi vo ariyā parisuddhakāyakammantā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesamahaṁ aññataro’ti.
analyzed: ye hi vo ariyā parisuddha kāya kammantā arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesam aham aññataro ti
translated: I am one of those noble ones who frequent wilderness & remote jungle tracts with pure bodily, verbal, & mental action.’

original: Etamahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, parisuddhakāyakammataṁ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomamāpādiṁ araññe vihārāya.
analyzed: etam aha brāhmaṇa parisuddha kāya kamma tam attani sampassamānaḥ bhiyyas pallomam āpādim araññe vihārāya
translated: Seeing this purity of bodily conduct in myself, I felt still more inclined to live in the forest.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā aparisuddhavacīkammantā …pe…
analyzed: ye kho keci samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā a parisuddha vacī kammantāḥ pe
translated: ‘There are some ascetics and Brahmins who, though their verbal conduct is impure…

original: aparisuddhamanokammantā …pe…
analyzed: a parisuddha manaḥ kammantā pe
translated: … their mental conduct is impure…

original: aparisuddhājīvā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti, aparisuddhājīvasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṁ bhayabheravaṁ avhāyanti.
analyzed: a parisuddha ājīvāḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti a parisuddha ājīva sandosa hetu have te bhonto samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ akusalam bhaya bheravam avhāyanti
translated: … their livelihood is impure, still go to live in the forest. And it is possible that because of the impurity of their livelihood they may experience fear, dread and terror.

original: Na kho panāhaṁ aparisuddhājīvo araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi;
analyzed: na kho pana aham a parisuddha ājīvaḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi
translated: But I do not live in the forest with an impure livelihood.

original: parisuddhājīvohamasmi.
analyzed: parisuddha ājīvā uham asmi
translated: I have a pure livelihood.

original: Ye hi vo ariyā parisuddhājīvā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesamahaṁ aññataro’ti.
analyzed: ye hi vaḥ ariyā parisuddha ājīvā arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesam aham aññataro ti
translated: I am one of those Noble Ones who have a pure livelihood and live in the forest.’

original: Etamahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, parisuddhājīvataṁ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomamāpādiṁ araññe vihārāya.
analyzed: etam aha brāhmaṇa parisuddha ājīvatam attani sampassamānaḥ bhiyyas pallomam āpādim araññe vihārāya
translated: Seeing this purity of livelihood in myself, I felt still more inclined to live in the forest.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, etadahosi:🔽‘ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā abhijjhālū kāmesu tibbasārāgā araññavanapatthāni
analyzed: tassa brāhmaṇaḥ  ye kho keci samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā abhijjhālū kāmesu tibba sārāgāḥ arañña vana patthāni
translated: I thought:

original: pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti, abhijjhālukāmesutibbasārāgasandosahetu have te bhonto🔽samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṁ bhayabheravaṁ avhāyanti.🔽Na kho panāhaṁ abhijjhālu kāmesu tibbasārāgo araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi;
analyzed: pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti have te bhonto  samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ akusalam bhaya bheravam avhāyanti  na kho pana aham abhijjhālu kāmesu tibba sārāgaḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi
translated: ‘Those ascetics and brahmins who are greedy for sensual pleasures, who are overwhelmed by sensual lust, who are burning with sensual lust, who are enslaved by sensual pleasures, who seek to enjoy sensual pleasures here and there,🔽because of their greed for sensual pleasures, their sensual lust, their burning with sensual lust, they declare what is unwholesome to be wholesome,🔽but I do not seek to enjoy sensual pleasures here and there.

original: anabhijjhālūhamasmi.
analyzed: an abhijjhālūham asmi
translated: I am not greedy for sensual pleasures, not overwhelmed by sensual lust, not burning with sensual lust, not enslaved by sensual pleasures.

original: Ye hi vo ariyā anabhijjhālū araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti, tesamahaṁ aññataro’ti.
analyzed: ye hi vaḥ ariyāḥ anabhijjhālū arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesam aham aññataro ti
translated: I am one of those noble ones who are not greedy for sensual pleasures and who resort to remote lodgings in the forest and jungle.’

original: Etamahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, anabhijjhālutaṁ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomamāpādiṁ araññe vihārāya.
analyzed: etam aha brāhmaṇa an abhijjhālutam attani sampassamānaḥ bhiyyas pallomam āpādim araññe vihārāya
translated: Seeing this quality of not being greedy for sensual pleasures in myself, I felt still more confident of dwelling in the forest.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā byāpannacittā paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappā araññavanapatthāni
analyzed: ye kho keci samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā byāpanna cittāḥ paduṭṭha mana saṅkappāḥ arañña vana patthāni
translated: ‘Those ascetics and brahmins who are malicious, with evil wishes and wrong views, who resort to remote lodgings in the forest and jungle,

original: pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti, byāpannacittapaduṭṭhamanasaṅkappasandosahetu have
analyzed: pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti byāpanna citta paduṭṭha mana saṅkappa sandosa hetu have
translated: They use secluded resting places in the wilderness and the forest. But because of their thoughts of ill will and their angry, bitter, and upset minds,

original: te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṁ bhayabheravaṁ avhāyanti.
analyzed: te bhontaḥ samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ akusalam bhaya bheravam avhāyanti
translated: they experience fear, terror, and horror.

original: Na kho panāhaṁ byāpannacitto paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi;
analyzed: na kho pana aham byāpanna cittaḥ paduṭṭha mana saṅkappaḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi
translated: But I don’t use secluded resting places in the wilderness and the forest with a mind of ill will and angry, bitter, and upset thoughts.

original: mettacittohamasmi.
analyzed: metta cittā aham asmi
translated: I have a mind of good will.

original: Ye hi vo ariyā mettacittā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesamahaṁ aññataro’ti.
analyzed: ye hi vaḥ ariyāḥ metta cittāḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesam aham aññataro ti
translated: I am one of those noble ones who use secluded resting places in the wilderness and the forest with a mind of good will.’

original: Etamahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, mettacittataṁ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomamāpādiṁ araññe vihārāya.
analyzed: etam aha brāhmaṇa metta cittatam attani sampassamānaḥ bhiyyas pallomam āpādim araññe vihārāya
translated: Brahmin, seeing this good will in myself, I felt even more inspired to stay in the wilderness.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, etadahosi:🔽‘ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā thinamiddhapariyuṭṭhitā araññavanapatthāni pantāni
analyzed: tassa brāhmaṇaḥ  ye kho keci samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā thinamiddha pariyuṭṭhitāḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni
translated: I thought:

original: senāsanāni paṭisevanti, thinamiddhapariyuṭṭhānasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā
analyzed: senāsanāni paṭisevanti thinam iddha pariyuṭṭhāna sandosa hetu have te bhonto samaṇa brāhmaṇā
translated: ‘There are some ascetics and brahmins who use secluded resting places in the wilderness and the forest. But because of their thoughts of sloth and torpor,

original: akusalaṁ bhayabheravaṁ avhāyanti.
analyzed: akusalam bhaya bheravam avhāyanti
translated: they experience fear, terror, and horror.

original: Na kho panāhaṁ thinamiddhapariyuṭṭhito araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi;
analyzed: na kho pana aham thinamiddha pariyuṭṭhitaḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi
translated: But I don’t stay in the wilderness because I’m overcome by drowsiness and sluggishness.

original: vigatathinamiddhohamasmi.
analyzed: vigata thinamiddhā uham asmi
translated: I’m free from drowsiness and sluggishness.

original: Ye hi vo ariyā vigatathinamiddhā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesamahaṁ aññataro’ti.
analyzed: ye hi vaḥ ariyāḥ vigata thinamiddhāḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesam aham aññataro ti
translated: I’m one of those noble ones who stay in the wilderness because they’re free from drowsiness and sluggishness.’

original: Etamahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, vigatathinamiddhataṁ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomamāpādiṁ araññe vihārāya.
analyzed: etam aha brāhmaṇa vigata thinam id hatam attani sampassamānaḥ bhiyyas pallomam āpādim araññe vihārāya
translated: Seeing this quality of being free from drowsiness and sluggishness in myself, I felt even more confident about staying in the wilderness.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: I thought:

original: ‘ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā uddhatā avūpasantacittā araññavanapatthāni pantāni🔽senāsanāni paṭisevanti, uddhataavūpasantacittasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā
analyzed: ye kho keci samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā uddhatāḥ a vūpasanta cittāḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni  senāsanāni paṭisevanti uddhata a vūpasanta citta sandosa hetu have te bhonto samaṇa brāhmaṇā
translated: ‘Those contemplatives and brahmans who are restless and unsettled in mind stay in the wilderness.

original: akusalaṁ bhayabheravaṁ avhāyanti.
analyzed: akusalam bhaya bheravam avhāyanti
translated: Because of their restless and unsettled minds, they’re frightened, fearful, and anxious.

original: Na kho panāhaṁ uddhato avūpasantacitto araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi;
analyzed: na kho pana aham uddhataḥ a vūpasanta cittaḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi
translated: But I don’t stay in the wilderness because I’m restless and unsettled in mind.

original: vūpasantacittohamasmi.
analyzed: vūpasanta cittā ham asmi
translated: I’m settled in mind.

original: Ye hi vo ariyā vūpasantacittā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti, tesamahaṁ aññataro’ti.
analyzed: ye hi vaḥ ariyāḥ vūpasanta cittāḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesam aham aññataro ti
translated: I am one of those noble ones who, with their minds calmed, make use of remote jungle-thicket resting places in the forest.

original: Etamahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, vūpasantacittataṁ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomamāpādiṁ araññe vihārāya.
analyzed: etam aha brāhmaṇa vūpasanta cittatam attani sampassamānaḥ bhiyyas pallomam āpādim araññe vihārāya
translated: Seeing this quality of having a calmed mind in myself, I took even greater delight in the wilderness.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, etadahosi:
analyzed: tassa brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: Then it occurred to me:

original: ‘ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā kaṅkhī vicikicchī araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni🔽paṭisevanti, kaṅkhivicikicchisandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṁ bhayabheravaṁ avhāyanti.
analyzed: ye kho keci samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā kaṅkhī vicikicchī arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni  paṭisevanti kaṅkhi vicikicchi sandosa hetu have te bhonto samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ akusalam bhaya bheravam avhāyanti
translated: ‘Those contemplatives & brahmans who are doubtful, uncertain, & undecided about the Four Noble Truths🔽are, on account of that doubt, uncertainty, & indecision, bound for one of two destinations: hell or the animal realm.

original: Na kho panāhaṁ kaṅkhī vicikicchī araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi;
analyzed: na kho pana aham kaṅkhī vicikicchī arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi
translated: But I am not doubtful, uncertain, or undecided about the Four Noble Truths.

original: tiṇṇavicikicchohamasmi.
analyzed: tiṇṇa vicikicchā uham asmi
translated: I am free from doubt, uncertainty, & indecision.

original: Ye hi vo ariyā tiṇṇavicikicchā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesamahaṁ aññataro’ti.
analyzed: ye hi vaḥ ariyā tiṇṇa vicikicchāḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti tesam aham aññataro ti
translated: I am one of those noble ones who, free from doubt, make use of remote jungle-thicket resting places in the forest.’

original: Etamahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, tiṇṇavicikicchataṁ attani sampassamāno bhiyyo pallomamāpādiṁ araññe vihārāya.
analyzed: etam aha brāhmaṇa tiṇṇa vicikicchatam attani sampassamānaḥ bhiyyas pallomam āpādim araññe vihārāya
translated: Seeing that I had crossed over doubt in regard to these three, I felt even greater confidence in living the spiritual life.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, etadahosi:🔽‘ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā attukkaṁsakā paravambhī araññavanapatthāni pantāni
analyzed: tassa brāhmaṇaḥ  ye kho keci samaṇāḥ vā brāhmaṇāḥ vā attukkasakā arañña vana patthāni pantāni
translated: I thought:🔽‘There are some ascetics and Brahmins who, while living off the food of the faithful, go about praising themselves and disparaging others.

original: senāsanāni paṭisevanti, attukkaṁsanaparavambhanasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā

original: Idamahaṁ tesaṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ sammohavihārasmiṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: idam aham tesam samaṇa brāhmaṇānam sammoha vihārasmin vadāmi
translated: I say that this is a state of bewilderment for those recluses and brahmins.

original: Ahaṁ kho pana, brāhmaṇa, rattiṁyeva samānaṁ rattīti sañjānāmi, divāyeva samānaṁ divāti sañjānāmi.
analyzed: aham khalu pana brāhmaṇa rattiyā iva samānam ratti iti sañjānāmi divāyā iva samānam divā iti sañjānāmi
translated: But when night has fallen, I perceive it as night, and when day has dawned, I perceive it as day.

original: Yaṁ kho taṁ, brāhmaṇa, sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: yam khalu te brāhmaṇa sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: If anyone speaking rightly could say of anyone:

original: ‘asammohadhammo satto loke uppanno bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan’ti, mameva taṁ sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: asammoha dhammaḥ sattaḥ loke uppannaḥ bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussānam ti mama eva tam sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: ‘A being not subject to delusion has appeared in the world for the welfare and happiness of many, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, welfare and happiness of gods and humans.’

original: ‘asammohadhammo satto loke uppanno bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan’ti.🔽Āraddhaṁ kho pana me, brāhmaṇa, vīriyaṁ ahosi asallīnaṁ, upaṭṭhitā sati asammuṭṭhā, passaddho kāyo asāraddho, samāhitaṁ cittaṁ ekaggaṁ.
analyzed: asammoha dhammaḥ sattaḥ loke uppannaḥ bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussānam ti  āraddham kho pana me brāhmaṇa vīriyam ahosi a sallīnaḥ upaṭṭhitā sati a sammuṭṭhā passaddhaḥ kāyaḥ a sāraddhaḥ samāhitam cittam ekagga
translated: ‘A being not subject to delusion has appeared in the world for the welfare and happiness of many, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, welfare and happiness of gods and humans.’🔽My energy was aroused and unflagging, my mindfulness was established and alert, and my body was tranquil and undisturbed.

original: So kho ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: saḥ kho aha brāhmaṇa vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja vihāsi
translated: Quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, I entered upon and abided in the first jhāna, which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, with rapture and pleasure born of seclusion.

original: Vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.🔽Pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca vihāsiṁ, sato ca sampajāno sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṁvedesiṁ;
analyzed: vitakka vicārānam vūpasamāḥ ajjhattam sampasādanam cetasaḥ eka udi bhāvam a vitakkam a vicāram samādhi jam pīti sukham dutiyam jhānam upasampajja vihāsi  pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca vihāsi sato ca sampajāno sukham ca kāyena paṭisavedesi
translated: With the stilling of applied and sustained thought, I entered and remained in the second jhāna, which has internal confidence and unification of mind, is without applied thought, is without sustained thought, and has rapture and happiness born of concentration.

original: yaṁ taṁ ariyā ācikkhanti: ‘upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.
analyzed: yam tam ariyāḥ ācikkhanti upekkhakaḥ satimā sukha vihārī iti tatiyam jhānam upasampajja vihāsi
translated: With the fading away of rapture, I remained in equanimity, mindful and alert, and physically sensitive of happiness, I entered and remained in the third jhāna, of which the noble ones declare: ‘He is equanimous, mindful, one who remains in happiness.’

original: Sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja vihāsiṁ.🔽So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye🔽ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ. So anekavihitaṁ
analyzed: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbā iva somanassa domanassānam atthaṅgamā adukkham asukham upekkhā sati pārisuddhim catuttham jhānam upasampajja vihāsi  saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye  ṭhite āneñja ppatte pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi saḥ aneka vihita
translated: With the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous passing away of joy and displeasure, I entered and remained in the fourth jhāna, neither painful nor pleasant, which has purification of mindfulness by equanimity.🔽When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilement, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the recollection of past lives. I recollected my manifold past lives, that is, one birth, two

original: pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi,
analyzed: pubbenivāsam anussarāmi
translated: births, three births, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, one hundred, one thousand, one hundred thousand, many eons of cosmic🔽contraction, many eons of cosmic expansion, many eons of cosmic contraction and expansion: ‘There I had such a name, belonged to such a clan, had such an appearance. Such was my food, such my sensitivity, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such the end of my life. Passing away from that state, I re-arose there. There too I had such a name, belonged to such a clan, had such an appearance. Such was my food, such my sensitivity, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such the end of my life. Passing away from that state, I re-arose here.’ Thus I remembered my manifold past lives in their modes and details.

original: seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo tissopi jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo
analyzed: sā iyyathidam ekam pi jātim dve pi jātiyaḥ tisso api jātiyaḥ catasso pi jātiyaḥ pañca api jātiyaḥ
translated: such as one birth, two births, three births, four births, five births,

original: dasapi jātiyo vīsampi jātiyo tiṁsampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyo🔽jātisatampi jātisahassampi jātisatasahassampi anekepi saṁvaṭṭakappe anekepi vivaṭṭakappe
analyzed: dasa api jātiyaḥ vīsampi jātiyaḥ tisampi jātiyaḥ cattālīsampi jātiyaḥ paññāsampi jātiyaḥ  jāti satam pi jāti sahassam pi jāti sata sahassam pi aneke pi savaṭṭa kappe aneke pi vivaṭṭa kappe
translated: ten births, twenty births, thirty births, forty births, fifty births,🔽a hundred births, a thousand births, a hundred thousand births,

original: anekepi saṁvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe: ‘amutrāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī🔽evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṁ; tatrāpāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo
analyzed: aneke pi sa vaṭṭa vivaṭṭa kappe amutra asim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgottaḥ eva vaṇṇo evam āhāraḥ eva sukha dukkha ppaṭisavedī  evam āyu pariyantaḥ saḥ tatas cutaḥ amutra udapādi eva nāmaḥ evaṅgottaḥ eva vaṇṇaḥ
translated: many eons of world-dissolution, many eons of world-evolution, many eons of world-dissolution and evolution: ‘There I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life-term;

original: evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto idhūpapanno’ti.
analyzed: evam āhāraḥ eva sukha dukkha ppaṭisavedī evam āyu pariyanto saḥ tatas cutaḥ idhu upapanno ti
translated: and passing away from there, I reappeared elsewhere; and there too I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life-term; and passing away from there, I reappeared here.’

original: Iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarāmi.
analyzed: iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarāmi
translated: Thus with its aspects and particulars, I recollect many past lives.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā,
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa rattiyā paṭhame yāme paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā
translated: This was the first true knowledge attained by me in the first watch of the night.

original: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato āloko uppanno, yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.🔽So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte sattānaṁ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato  saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte sattānam cutūpapāta ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi
translated: Ignorance was dispelled and knowledge arose, darkness was dispelled and light arose, as happens to one who dwells heedful, ardent, and resolute.🔽When my concentrated mind was purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings.

original: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne🔽hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi: ‘ime vata🔽bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā vacīduccaritena samannāgatā manoduccaritena🔽samannāgatā ariyānaṁ upavādakā micchādiṭṭhikā micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā; te kāyassa
analyzed: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne  hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi ime vata  bhonto sattā kāya duccaritena samannāgatāḥ vacī duccaritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ duccaritena  samannāgatāḥ ariyānam upavādakāḥ micchādiṭṭhikāḥ micchādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā te kāyassa
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I saw beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate. I understood how beings pass on according to their actions thus:🔽‘These worthy beings who are ill-conducted in body, speech, and mind, revilers of noble ones, wrong in their views, giving effect to wrong view, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a state of deprivation, in a bad destination, in perdition, even in hell.

original: bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapannā. Ime vā pana bhonto
analyzed: bhedāḥ param maraṇāḥ apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapannāḥ ime vā pana bhontaḥ
translated: But these worthy beings who are well-conducted in body, speech, and mind, not revilers of noble ones, right in their views, giving effect to right view, on the dissolution of the body, after death, have reappeared in a good destination, even in the heavenly world.’🔽Thus with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I saw beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate. I understood how beings pass on according to their actions.

original: sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā🔽ariyānaṁ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā; te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ🔽maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā’ti. Iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena
analyzed: sattā kāya su caritena samannāgatā vacī su caritena samannāgatā manaḥ su caritena samannāgatā  ariyānaṃ an upavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā te kāyassa bhedā para  maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā ati iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena
translated: who have done good things by way of body, speech, and mind,🔽who have not maligned noble ones, who have right view and a right view action, and who, after death, have reappeared in a good place, a heavenly world.

original: satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi.
analyzed: satte passāmi cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāmi
translated: Thus with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I see beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and I understand how beings pass on according to their actions.

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā,
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā
translated: This was the second knowledge I attained in the last watch of the night.

original: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato āloko uppanno, yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed; light arose—as happens in one who is heedful, ardent, and resolute.

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṁ khayañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmesiṁ.🔽So ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmesi  so idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūta
translated: When my mind was thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilements, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, I directed it to knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī🔽paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ.🔽‘Ime āsavā’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ āsavasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ,
analyzed: abbhaññā asi ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūtam abbhaññā asi ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī  paṭipadā ati yathābhūtam  ime āsavā ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam āsava samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the origin of suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’

original: ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ, ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: ayam āsava nirodho ti yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi ayam āsava nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati  yathābhūtam abbhaññāsi
translated: I directly knew as it actually is: ‘These are the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the origin of the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the cessation of the taints.’ I directly knew as it actually is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of the taints.’

original: Tassa me evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha, bhavāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha, avijjāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccittha.
analyzed: tassa me evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccittha bhava āsavā api cittam vimuccittha avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccittha
translated: When I knew and saw thus, my mind was liberated from the taint of sensual desire, from the taint of being, and from the taint of ignorance.

original: Vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam ahosi
translated: And I knew that my mind was liberated from the defilements by non-clinging.

original: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti abbhaññāsiṁ.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: I directly knew: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

original: Ayaṁ kho me, brāhmaṇa, rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā vijjā adhigatā,
analyzed: ayam kho me brāhmaṇa rattiyā pacchime yāme tatiyā vijjā adhigatā
translated: This was the third true insight, which I attained in the last part of the night.

original: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato āloko uppanno, yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: Ignorance was destroyed; knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed; light arose, as happens for a diligent, ardent, and resolute person who lives heedful, ardent, and resolute.

original: Siyā kho pana te, brāhmaṇa, evamassa:
analyzed: siyā kho pana te brāhmaṇaḥ evam assa
translated: Brahmin, you might think:

original: ‘ajjāpi nūna samaṇo gotamo avītarāgo avītadoso avītamoho, tasmā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevatī’ti.
analyzed: ajja api nūna samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ a vīta rāgaḥ a vīta dosaḥ a vīta mohaḥ tasmai arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevati iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama still has lust and desire, that’s why he stays in the wilderness.’

original: Na kho panetaṁ, brāhmaṇa, evaṁ daṭṭhabbaṁ.
analyzed: na kho pana ita brāhmaṇaḥ evam
translated: But you shouldn’t see it like that.

original: Dve kho ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, atthavase sampassamāno araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi—
analyzed: dve kho aha brāhmaṇa attha vase sampassamānaḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi
translated: I stay in the wilderness for two reasons:

original: attano ca diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāraṁ sampassamāno, pacchimañca janataṁ anukampamāno”ti.
analyzed: attano ca diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāram sampassamāno pacchimam ca janatam anukampamāno ti
translated: I see it as a pleasant place for a person like me to stay, and I have compassion for future generations.”

original: “Anukampitarūpā vatāyaṁ bhotā gotamena pacchimā janatā, yathā taṁ arahatā sammāsambuddhena.
analyzed: anukampita rūpā vata ayam bhotā gotamena pacchimā janatā yathā tam arahatā sammāsambuddhena
translated: “Master Gotama has shown compassion for the people of the future,

original: Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama. Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama
translated: Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent, Master Gotama!🔽Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned,

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost,

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,

analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: in the same way has Master Gotama—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to Master Gotama for refuge, to the Dhamma, and to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
